DataElement.preferredName: Reuse Template Study Activity Name Code PCORnet CDM Clinical Observation Terminology Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._Terminology / vocabulary used to describe the clinical observation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PCORnet CDM Clinical Observation Terminology Type

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.

Concepts.longName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
Concepts.definition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Published by the The Regenstrief Institute, the Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes covers clinical and clinical laboratory terminology.

Concepts.longName: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes
Concepts.definition: Published by The Regenstrief Institute, the Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes covers clinical and clinical laboratory terminology.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

Concepts.definition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
